page.title: 06Transport in Swimbridge
page.content: { In 1985 many families have at least {one motor car and some have more than {this.} Personal transport is regarded by many as a necessity. Even a few years ago most children walked to school, now only the nearest arrive this way while all the rest travel in private motor cars. {Many people {continue to use the hourly bus for {shopping expeditions into Barnstaple {or to go to South Molton for secondary {education. The A.361 passes through the village and on a Friday in May we noted that an average of 200 vehicles used the route in both directions during school hours. It is estimted that around a million vehicles use this road in both directions annually. {Approximately {15% of these vehicles are heavy {lorries, 80% private cars with around {5% bicycles, buses and coaches. }
